result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miranda Jamie McNamara

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Bond remains in its present form. Court adjourned at 12:03 pm.

11:36 AM Miranda Jamie McNamara does not appear in Court,  Atty Scott Selmer,  ADA Kaley Walker for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Walker states she just had a hearing with the DE and there was confusion on an in court appearance verses zoom appearance and is asking the Court call her if no objection. Atty Selmer states he has not met or talked with her yet. ADA Walker is asking the Court call DE and proceed with the PH. Court calls DE. Recess. Back on at 11:51 am w/same appearances. The State is ready to proceed. Court takes judicial notice of the complaint in 22CF96. Janelle Wolf. S/T. ADA Walker questions Ms. Wolf. Court takes judicial notice and record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Selmer. ADA Walker is asking the Court find probable cause and bind DE over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

from Judge Rohl to Atty Selmer's letter "Our initial appearances are scheduled on Mondays. They are often scheduled before they are sent to the PD for appointment of an attorney. There was email correspondence about this case which included Atty Selmer, noting that they would have an attorney cover the IA since the hearings are always held on Mondays.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY
COMPLIANCE WITH ANY CASES INVOLVING CHILDREN
Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center for fingerprints and photograph.

9:56 AM Defendant Miranda Jamie McNamara in Court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in Court for Attorney Scott Selmer.  ADA Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court advises Defendant of rights, charges and possible penalties.  State requests $10,000 signature bond w/conditions of absolute sobriety and compliance with any cases involving children.  No objection. Court orders bond as requested.  Court advises Defendant of right to speedy preliminary hearing, defendant waives.  Court sets PH w/Atty. Selmer's calendar.  Atty. Satorious requests Defendant be allowed to appear via Zoom if needed as she will be going to treatment.  Court grants permission for Zoom appearance but she or attorney must notify the COC five days before hearing if remote appearance is needed.  Adjourned at 10:03 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
from Atty Selmer requesting to reschedule the initial appearance and he be allowed to have scheduling input.
from Atty Selmer requesting the initial appearance on 8/22 be rescheduled, the date was unilaterally scheduled and will not work for him.
from Court Commissioner Gavic to Atty. Selmer's letters.  "Reschedule Initial Appearance"
Initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Additional request from Atty. Selmer that he be allowed to appear via Zoom for IA.
from Atty. Selmer for Defendant to appear via Zoom at IA.
Initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
